cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with the problem of data shuffling in distributed learning systems, which involves communication and storage constraints. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) category, which deals with the fundamental limits of communication and information processing. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel coded shuffling scheme, which involves coding and decoding functions, indicating a possible connection to the Distributed Computing (cs.DC) category. The paper also deals with the optimization of communication and storage resources, which could be related to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) category. Furthermore, the paper involves machine learning and data processing, which could be related to the Learning (cs.LG) category. Finally, the paper involves networked systems and communication protocols, which could be related to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) category.
